jsky.science
Class Time

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--jsky.science.AbstractScienceObject
        |
        +--jsky.science.AbstractScienceObjectNode
              |
              +--jsky.science.Quantity
                    |
                    +--jsky.science.Time
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable, java.util.EventListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, ReplaceablePropertyChangeListener, ScienceObjectModel, ScienceObjectNodeModel, java.io.Serializable
public class Time
extends Quantity

Time, an object to manage units of Time. This is not Time of Day based (see Java Calendar class for that stuff, but rather amounts of Time. Manages a global static default Unit and conversion between Time units.

This code was developed by NASA, Goddard Space Flight Center, Code 587 for the Scientist's Expert Assistant (SEA) project for Next Generation Space Telescope (NGST).

See Also:

public Time(double inValue,
            java.lang.String inUnits)
primary constructor
Parameters:
inValue - double of the actual Time
inUnits - string containing the units in which the Time is given currently "HOURs" and "meters" and "angstroms" are supported
